meanings.sent1: She tiffed when her brother took her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: He tiffed at the long wait in line.
meanings.sent3: The cat tiffed at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The engine tiffed as it struggled to start in the cold weather.
meanings.sent5: The teacher tiffed at the noisy students in the classroom.

meanings.sent1: Their tiffed lasted only a few minutes before they made up.
meanings.sent2: The siblings had a tiffed over who would get the last cookie.
meanings.sent3: The tiffed between the friends was quickly forgotten over a shared joke.
meanings.sent4: The tiffed between the neighbors was like a storm passing through.
meanings.sent5: The tiffed at the meeting was resolved with a compromise.
